page.title: 10RESIDENT OF COFFINSWELL.
page.content: The name Coffinswell has come from a man called Caffrins who owned many willas(villas).Caffrins-willa became Coffinswell.The cottages in the village are all approximately 400 years old though the oldest is 600 years old.There are approximately 30 children in the village,the number has decreased throughout the years.The villagers main shops are in Newton-Abbot and Torquay,although in earlier years there would have been shops in the village.When the villagers run out of important foods there is a man who delivers it to the villagers.There is a tree surgeon in the village,but the proper doctor is in Kingskerswell.The main leisure activity is looking at the wonderful views,although there is a Craft Club and a small church in the village Interview with Mrs.Buck of Coffinswell
